aicpa-topic.title: Interpretations of Rules

body.p:
3.09 Published interpretations of certain rules of the regulatory bodies
Appendix A, "Information Sources," of this guide contains contact information for many of the organizations listed here.
may be found in the following reference materials:

li.p: Financial and Operational Combined Uniform Single (FOCUS) Report forms (Form X-17A-5 Part II and Part IIA) and their general instructions, which include line-item references to specific rules. These forms can be accessed at www.sec.gov/about/forms/secforms.htm.
SEC interpretative releases (1934 Act series) and published interpretative and no-action letters, which can be accessed at www.sec.gov/divisions/marketreg/mr-noaction.shtml.

SEC views of the staff of the Division of Trading and Markets, in the form of FAQs, that are relevant to SEC Rule 17a-5 and other financial responsibility rules, which can be accessed at www.sec.gov/divisions/marketreg/mrfaq.htm.
Treasury Department interpretations, which can be accessed at www.federalreserve.gov/boarddocs/legalint/.
CFTC staff letters, which can be accessed at https://www.cftc.gov/LawRegulation/CFTCStaffLetters/letters.htm.
NFA interpretive notices, which can be accessed at https://www.nfa.futures.org/rulebook/index.aspx.
FINRA manual and regulatory notices, which can be accessed at https://www.finra.org/industry/notices.

FINRA publishes certain interpretive guidance it has received from the SEC’s Division of Trading and Markets on SEC rules regarding financial and operational matters, which can be accessed at https://www.finra.org/rules-guidance/guidance/interpretations-financial-operational-rules.

FINRA resource page for the SEC’s 2013 Financial Responsibility and Reporting Rule Amendments that includes links to FAQs, no-action letters and rule releases, which can be accessed at https://www.finra.org/rules-guidance/guidance/interpretations-financial-operational-rules.

FINRA resource page for recently added and rescinded 15c3-1 and 15c3-3 interpretations, which can be accessed at www.finra.org/rules-guidance/notices/21-27 and www.finra.org/rules-guidance/notices/21-45.
Interpretative instructions distributed to their respective memberships by other self-regulatory organizations.

body.p: 3.10 The broker-dealer may have requested and received specific interpretations or no-action letters from any regulatory agency since the prior audit. This information will assist in giving the issue appropriate consideration regarding their effect, if any, on the financial statements of the broker-dealer.
